brief_summary.textblock:
Measure accuracy of vein width using VeinViewer®, compared against ultrasound imaging as a
      gold standard

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Verification Evaluation of VeinViewer® Device

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Must be 18 years of age or older

          -  Must be able to read and understand English to understand the consent letter

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Less than 18 years of age

          -  Unable to read and understand English to understand the consent letter

intervention.description: VeinViewer® is designed to improve vascular access treatment standards and provide the highest possible quality in volunteer care. The device is a non-invasive handheld electronic visual aid device designed to project an image of superficial, subcutaneous vascular structures on the surface of the skin.  VeinViewer's primary purpose is to assist in vascular visualization for IV starts and blood draws.

clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Verification Evaluation of VeinViewer® Device

authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: The focus of this study is to understand the clinical effectiveness of the device.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
